key_title: Key to the genera of Sapindaceae

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons

source.author: Duretto, M.F.
source.title: Sapindaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Duretto, M.F. (1999). Sapindaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves opposite, deciduous; fruit of paired samaras
Leaves alternate, evergreen; fruit capsular (often with 3 or 4 papery wings)
Leaves simple or (in eastern Victoria) paripinnate; plants monoecious; sepals fused; fruit lobed, indehiscent with a prominent red aril

Leaves simple or imparipinnate or rarely (in western Victoria) paripinnate; plants dioecious, sometimes with some bisexual flowers; sepals free; fruit a capsule, winged or angled, aril absent or white
